content.title: Aortic Arch Zone Classification (Zone 0-4)
content.definition: Standardized anatomic classification system defining proximal landing zones for thoracic endovascular aortic repair (TEVAR), based on the relationship to arch branch vessels.

zone_1.boundaries: Innominate artery to left carotid artery

zone_2.boundaries: Left carotid to left subclavian artery

zone_3.boundaries: Left subclavian to proximal descending aorta

learning_objectives: Define the 5 aortic arch landing zones
Identify which vessels require revascularization per zone
Understand stroke risk implications by zone
clinical_pearls: Zone 0 = most complex, highest stroke risk
Always consider left subclavian revascularization before coverage
Dominant left vertebral is absolute indication for subclavian revascularization
